body.p:
Nashville Tennessee Decr 17th 1860
To his Excellincy the Governor of Kentucky

Sir being about to change my residence I deem it my duty to apprize you of it, after tendering you my unfeigned thanks for your Kind patronage, I herewith hand you my resignation as Commissioner of deeds &c for your State, which you will please accept.

And being aware of the desire of the citizens of this City, that a Successor Should be immediately appointed I hope you will not think it presumption in me to name as my Successor, Col Hardin P Bostick, a gentleman every way qualified to discharge the duties of the office with Satisfaction to his Constitutents and to with credit to himself, and whose application accompanies this communication
Your favorable consideration, will confer upon him a lasting favor, and I Know will meet the approbation of the citizens of this city and State

With high regard I am
Your obt Servt
Egbert A Raworth

Tennessee
Comr. of Deeds
H. P. Bostick
Nashville
Appd. Jany 14. 1861
